items.title: AttributeError: 'generator' object has no attribute 'longrepr'
items.body: latest reportPortal version 5.0.3

items.title: Connection pool is full, discarding connection  > RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded
items.body:
**Short Description:**
Running into "Connection pool is full, discarding connection" when logging from the test case itself using default settings.


**Environment:**
Server: 5.2.2
Client:
- macOS Mojave: 10.14.6 (18G5033)
- Python 3.7.3
- pip freeze:
```
attrs==19.3.0
certifi==2020.6.20
chardet==3.0.4
dill==0.3.2
idna==2.10
importlib-metadata==1.7.0
more-itertools==8.4.0
packaging==20.4
pluggy==0.13.1
py==1.9.0
pyparsing==2.4.7
pytest==5.4.3
pytest-reportportal==5.0.3
reportportal-client==5.0.3
requests==2.24.0
six==1.15.0
urllib3==1.25.9
wcwidth==0.2.5
zipp==3.1.0
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Setting up env:

1. python3 -m venv venv
2. source venv/bin/activate
3. pip install pytest-reportportal

pytest.ini: (located in root of project)
```ini
[pytest]
log_cli = True
log_cli_level = DEBUG
addopts = --reportportal
rp_uuid = c8bxxxa-fc62-4a3e-b74d-5c050728xxxx
rp_endpoint = https://reportportal.io-repor... redacted
rp_project = xxxx_personal
rp_launch = pytest_ur_agent_test
rp_ignore_errors = True
rp_verify_ssl = True
```

test_reportportal.py (located in tests folder)
```python
import logging

def test_rp():
    '''Testing basic connection to reportportal'''
    logging.debug("Logging to reportportal from the test")
    logging.info("info level")
    logging.warning("warning level")
    logging.error("error level")
    logging.fatal("fatal level")
```
 
**Executing tests:** (ca_bundle.pem holds our certs, putting it in here for transparency)
env REQUESTS_CA_BUNDLE=ca_bundle.pem pytest tests

**The results:**
Seen from reportportal the launch and testcase is created and started. Only the logging.debug statement is received no other logs are sent.
The agent is stuck in a loop where it sets up 10+ https connections ending up violating the connectionpool max size set in 

`venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/requests/adapters.py:50`
DEFAULT_POOLSIZE = 10

resulting in `urllib3.connectionpool:connectionpool.py:303 Connection pool is full, discarding connection`

The `max_pool_size = 50` set by 
`venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/reportportal_client/service.py:189`
seem not to affect this situation.

**Observations:**
_**observation 1**_
When changing the DEFAULT_POOLSIZE in requests/adapters.py to 50 as reportportal_client/service.py tries it runs into:
RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded

```
...
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1519, in _log
INTERNALERROR>     self.handle(record)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1529, in handle
INTERNALERROR>     self.callHandlers(record)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1591, in callHandlers
INTERNALERROR>     hdlr.handle(record)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 905, in handle
INTERNALERROR>     self.emit(record)
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytest_reportportal/rp_logging.py", line 102, in emit
INTERNALERROR>     attachment=record.__dict__.get('attachment', None),
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytest_reportportal/service.py", line 329, in post_log
INTERNALERROR>     self.rp.log(**sl_rq)
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/reportportal_client/service.py", line 394, in log
INTERNALERROR>     r = self.session.post(url=url, json=data, verify=self.verify_ssl)
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 578, in post
INTERNALERROR>     return self.request('POST', url, data=data, json=json, **kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 530, in request
INTERNALERROR>     resp = self.send(prep, **send_kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 643, in send
INTERNALERROR>     r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 449, in send
INTERNALERROR>     timeout=timeout
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 659, in urlopen
INTERNALERROR>     conn = self._get_conn(timeout=pool_timeout)

INTERNALERROR>     self.port or "443",
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1371, in debug
INTERNALERROR>     self._log(DEBUG, msg, args, **kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytest_reportportal/rp_logging.py", line 120, in _log
INTERNALERROR>     return original_func(self, *args, **kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1519, in _log
INTERNALERROR>     self.handle(record)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1529, in handle
INTERNALERROR>     self.callHandlers(record)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1591, in callHandlers
INTERNALERROR>     hdlr.handle(record)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 905, in handle
INTERNALERROR>     self.emit(record)
INTERNALERROR>   File "redacted/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/logging.py", line 773, in emit
INTERNALERROR>     if self.capture_manager
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/contextlib.py", line 239, in helper
INTERNALERROR>     return _GeneratorContextManager(func, args, kwds)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/contextlib.py", line 85, in __init__
INTERNALERROR>     doc = getattr(func, "__doc__", None)
INTERNALERROR> RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object
```

_**observation 2**_
Using to python 3.8.3 as basis for the venv
pip freeze is identical
_**Results are the same as 3.7.3**_

_**observation 3**_
Using to python 3.7.3 setup
Added rp_logger fixture to conftest.py copied 1:1 from docs. 
Altering the test to use the rp_logger fixture instead of the logging module.
_**Results are the same**_

_**observation 4**_
Using to python 3.7.3 setup
Altering test to do no logging but just assert false
```python
def test_rp():
    '''Testing basic connection to reportportal'''
    assert False
```
_**Results strack trace created in reportportal but agent is still gets stuck**_

_**observation 5**_
Using to python 3.7.3 as basis for the venv
Altering pytest.ini to use beta.demo.reportportal.io/
_**Results are the same**_

**Conclusion:**
So just as the agent, I'm a bit stuck here... I feel like there is something I missed but I'm not sure what obviously...
So do you guys have any suggestions to where I approached this wrong?
Or just the solution to all my problems? :)
Let me know ... 

**Backstory:**
Our production tests are currently running in an reportportal v4.3 env, and the agent we are using is a modded version cloned back in Sep 2019 which from my preliminary tests works with v5 but i would really love to get back to master.
For us to transition to ReportPortal v5 we need to be able to log in our test cases and fixtures.

items.title: --reportportal -o "rp_launch_attributes=key:error": tag is created on the portal, but is not added to "Cumulative trend chart"
items.body:
Earlier your had issue: https://github.com/reportportal/agent-python-pytest/issues/206

BUT

if run in this format: -o "rp_launch_attributes=sanya:krasava"

 u will see that test will not added to widget
tag will not create correctly: in your code u have:

because in your code:
attributes = [{'value': tag} for tag in
session.config.getini('rp_launch_attributes')]

if debug it - it looks like: value: sanya:krasava

but we need key and value

NOT only value

the issue is this code: https://github.com/reportportal/agent-python-pytest/blob/a28f9cf9f2eda4145bbebcd6f57ca8d2f300b1e7/pytest_reportportal/plugin.py#L81

`   attributes = [{'value': tag} for tag in
                      session.config.getini('rp_launch_attributes')]`

#https://github.com/reportportal/agent-python-pytest/pull/208

items.body:
Hi All,

I tried running pytest with --reportportal -o "rp_launch_attributes=TestingTags" command.
It doesn't add the attributes to the test launch.
I also tried -o "rp_launch_attributes=run_id:TestingTags" where 'run_id' is attribute key and 'TestingTags' is attribute value. That doesn't work as well.

I'm using below versions of lib
pytest==5.0.1
pytest-reportportal==5.0.3

Could someone help me resolve this.

items.title: Feature request: parametrize test description
Slow test execution
items.body:
When running selenium tests locally with reportportal enabled there is signification degradation. Tests are extremely slow where the execution difference is 2 minutes compared to reportportal not enabled. I have ran tests using xdist for threading and a single test without multiple processes and the result is the same. It seems that there is a lag or wait before each test action is executed. 

```
rp_project = webtest_demo
rp_launch = Webtests
rp_launch_attributes = 'PyTest' 'Smoke'
rp_tests_attributes = 'PyTest' 'Smoke'
rp_launch_description = 'WebTest Suite'
rp_ignore_errors = True
rp_ignore_tags = 'xfail' 'usefixture'
rp_hierarchy_dirs = True
rp_hierarchy_module = True
rp_hierarchy_class = True
rp_display_suite_test_file = True
rp_hierarchy_dirs_level = 0
rp_verify_ssl = true
rp_log_batch_size = 20
rp_hierarchy_parametrize = True
```
**NOTE**
If I set `rp_log_level = INFO` the execution time is normal.

OS: MAC
Browser: Chrome
ReportPortal: 5.1.0 on Kubernetes
pytest-reportportal 5.0.3
pytest 5.4.1
pytest-xdis 1.31.0
Python 3.8.0

I am using pytest to run tests and send the result to reportportal. Not sure if this is an agent bug or the web site that is doing anything wrong.

items.title: Test run freezes or get status:interrupted on reportportal 5
items.body:
I have a problem to report test results to report portal server.

when I use reportportal 4.3, pytest-reportportal 1.0.9, reportportal-client 3.2.3 and pytest 5.0.1
All is working. But when I use
reportportal 5, pytest-reportportal 5.0.1, reportportal-client 5.0.1 and pytest 5.0.1
test run freezes and when I run this:

    def test_one():
        x = "this"
        assert 'h' in x

the run is logged as a pass but gets status: interrupted.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44366788/78119437-b563d300-7408-11ea-8bff-0121fc228c8e.png)

 When it freezes I get no error and I try with 
     rp_ignore_errors = True
And I got no difference.

items.title: Tags do not appear to work
items.body:
Pytest.ini code:
```ini
[pytest]
markers =
    marker1: First marker
    marker2: Second marker
    marker3: Third marker

;Logging settings
log_cli = True
log_level = DEBUG
log_format = %(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(module)s[%(lineno)d] %(message)s

rp_endpoint = <my instance>
rp_project = <my project>
rp_launch = Report Portal Test

rp_ignore_errors = False
```

import pytest

def test1():

def test2():
    # Test should pass and show marker2 and marker3 for tags.

@pytest.mark.marker1

def test_failing_test():
    # Test should fail and show marker1 and marker3 for tags.

**Problem 1:**
Tags do not appear to work. As I understand it, the custom markers should be applied to the tests as tags. Additionally, I have specified a launch tag, but it does not appear as well.

I did some debugging, and found that the tags should be sent if the method `update_test_item` is on the client, but it does not appear to be. Looking at the client, that method is only in the v3 branch, not any release off of the `master` branch. Is this an upcoming feature?

**Problem 2:**
When I run this against my instance, the all 3 tests are marked as failed, even though only 1 of the 3 should. Any idea why this is happening?

I don't see why this is happening. This appears to be an error, but quizzically, does not appear to happen with another test run I have.

**Note:**
Apologies for the substitutions, but I did not want to give specific information from our environment. I can tell you that our locally hosted instance I am testing with is running RP 5.0.0. `pytest-reportportal` and `reportportal-client` are the latest released versions installed from PyPI.

items.body:
### test_base_api.py

`
""" This module contains all test cases."""

import sys
import logging
import unittest
import allure
import pytest
from BaseAPI.base_api import BaseAPI
from FrameworkUtilities.execution_status_utility import ExecutionStatus
import FrameworkUtilities.logger_utility as log_utils
from FrameworkUtilities.data_reader_utility import DataReader


@allure.story('Test Automation Demo for APIs')
@allure.feature('API Response Verification Using Requests')
@pytest.mark.usefixtures("rp_logger")
class BaseAPITests(unittest.TestCase):
    """
    This class contains the executable test cases.
    """

    data_reader = DataReader()

    def setUp(self):
        self.exe_status = ExecutionStatus()
        self.base_api = BaseAPI()
        self.log = log_utils.custom_logger(logging.INFO)

    def tearDown(self):
        # add db cleaning code here
        pass

    @pytest.fixture(autouse=True)
    def class_level_setup(self, request):
        """
        This method is used for one time setup of test execution process,
        which check for the test cases to run mentioned in the excel file.
        :return: it returns nothing
        """

        if self.data_reader.get_data(request.function.__name__, "Runmode") != "Y":
            pytest.skip("Excluded from current execution run.")

    @allure.testcase("Get All Users")
    @pytest.mark.smoke
    def test_verify_users(self, rp_logger):
        """
        This test is validating the users from api response. (positive scenario)
        :return: return test status
        """

        test_name = sys._getframe().f_code.co_name

        rp_logger.info("###### TEST EXECUTION STARTED :: " +
                       test_name + " ######")

        with allure.step("Get all users for this specific endpoint"):
            result = self.base_api.verify_users()
            self.exe_status.mark_final(test_step=test_name, result=result)

    @allure.testcase("Verify Valid User")
    @pytest.mark.regression
    def test_verify_valid_user(self, rp_logger):
        """
        This test is validating the users from api response. (positive scenario)
        :return: return test status
        """

        test_name = sys._getframe().f_code.co_name

        rp_logger.info("###### TEST EXECUTION STARTED :: " +
                       test_name + " ######")

        first_name = self.data_reader.get_data(test_name, 'FirstName')
        last_name = self.data_reader.get_data(test_name, 'LastName')
        email = self.data_reader.get_data(test_name, 'Email')

        with allure.step("Verify whether user exists"):
            result = self.base_api.verify_valid_user(
                email, first_name, last_name)
            self.exe_status.mark_final(test_step=test_name, result=result)

    @allure.testcase("Verify Invalid User")
    @pytest.mark.regression
    def test_verify_invalid_user(self, rp_logger):
        """
        This test is validating the users from api response. (negative scenario)
        :return: return test status
        """

        test_name = sys._getframe().f_code.co_name

        rp_logger.info("###### TEST EXECUTION STARTED :: " +
                       test_name + " ######")

        first_name = self.data_reader.get_data(test_name, 'FirstName')
        last_name = self.data_reader.get_data(test_name, 'LastName')
        email = self.data_reader.get_data(test_name, 'Email')

        with allure.step("Verify whether user exists"):
            result = self.base_api.verify_valid_user(
                email, first_name, last_name)
            self.exe_status.mark_final(test_step=test_name, result=result)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main(verbosity=2)
`

### conftest.py

`
import pytest


@pytest.fixture(scope="session")
def rp_logger(request):
    import logging
    logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)
    if hasattr(request.node.config, 'py_test_service'):
        from pytest_reportportal import RPLogger, RPLogHandler
        logging.setLoggerClass(RPLogger)
        rp_handler = RPLogHandler(request.node.config.py_test_service)
    else:
        import sys
        rp_handler = logging.StreamHandler(sys.stdout)
    rp_handler.setLevel(logging.INFO)
    yield logger
`

### console errors

TypeError: test_verify_valid_user() missing 1 required positional argument: 'rp_logger'

items.title: verify_ssl=False no longer works with client v3.2.2+ as of plugin v1.0.8
items.body:
https://github.com/reportportal/agent-python-pytest/pull/116 commented out the `verify_ssl` argument that `PyTestServiceClass.init_service()` was passing through to `ReportPortalServiceAsync()`, which I think was done to address https://github.com/reportportal/agent-python-pytest/issues/111 and https://github.com/reportportal/agent-python-pytest/issues/112.

However, I think the underlying issue was just that the required `reportportal-client` version was left as `>=3.1.0` when the `verify_ssl` changes were introduced, when it should've been bumped up to `>=3.2.2`.

Since then, the required client version was bumped up even beyond that to `reportportal-client>=3.2.3`, so I believe it should be possible to restore the `verify_ssl` argument that was commented out.

items.title: upload image to report
items.body:
I try to upload image to report
so the example in the agent-python doc is about text file and it works well
```python
import subprocess
    free_memory = subprocess.check_output("free -h".split())
    rp_logger.info(
        "Case1. Memory consumption",
        attachment={
            "name": "free_memory.txt",
            "data": free_memory,
            "mime": "application/octet-stream",
        },
    )
```

but if you want to upload image there is a problem
in the `data` key do you can't pass the path to the file because the path pass as a string to report portal, if you change the `mime` to `image/png` do you get 5000 code error (the data will be upload but the report portal can't load the file)

after investigation the way that it works for me is to load the file as a file, like this
```python
with open(screenshot_file_path, "rb") as image_file:
        screenshot_file_path = image_file.read()
rp_logger.info("Some Text Here",
                       attachment={"name": "test_name_screenshot.png",
                                             "data": screenshot_file_path,
                                             "mime": "image/png"})
```

it will be nice to document this

items.title: rp_ignore_errors doesn't apply on session start
items.body:
if there is some issue with the report portal from the very beginning (not reachable, access denied, etc.),
the `rp_ignore_errors` does not stop the py.test from crashing miserably.

the `plugin.py` hook: `pytest_sessionstart(session)`  initializes the service (`session.config.py_test_service.init_service()`)

and calls its `start_launch()` straight away. - one could possibly catch the `HTTP` error exception at this point and call `pytest_unconfigure(session.config)`, but this does not throw the exception straight away since it calls some async method (it just adds it to the queue).

items.title: pytest-reportportal hangs approx 1 out of 3 launches
items.body:
I am experiencing flakey behaviour with `pytest-reportportal`. This `pytest` plugin is active when running tests in Jenkins. The test results are then pushed to ReportPortal. Both systems run in the same set of machines on the company AWS account.

The unit test suite for one of our projects contains 2540 tests at the time of writing. Since we also have a precommit trigger on this project, I know for sure that all unit tests succeed.

When pushing the test results from Jenkins to RP, 1 out of 3 executions (on average) seem to hang. I have to kill the ongoing Jenkins run and then `Force finish` the launch on RP. This is not maintainable.

I would like to add more info, but the Jenkins console just sits there. The last line being reported was `pytest` saying that all tests ran correctly:

```
========================= 2540 passed in 31.49 seconds =========================
```

items.title: Nested hierarchy test items is hardcoded to standard pytest python/unittest
items.body:
For a customer, I wrote 2 custom pytest plugins. Each of these plugins contain custom Python subclasses of `pytest.File`, `pytest.Collector` and `pytest.Item` to create a nested tree of test suites and tests.

When using `pytest-reportportal`, this nested structure is flattened in ReportPortal. When looking at the code, I see explicit references to `pytest.Class`, `pytest.Function` and alike in the support for nesting. This limits the nesting only to pytests using the standard `python` or `unittest` plugins.

Please make `pytest-reportportal` agnostic to which plugin(s) generate test items: you should process the tree as returned by any possible pytest plugin.

Note: IDEs like `PyCharm` show the nested hierarcy returned by my pytest plugins correctly.

items.title: Enable implicit plugin usage by using a `--reportportal` flag
items.body:
Instead of activation the plugin by default and using pytest's disable plugin ability to shut it down, it would be nicer to enable it explicitly by sending a `--reportportal` flag:
`pytest tests --reportportal`
Which can also be used in the pytets.ini files:
```
[pytest]
addopts: --reportportal
```
If i'll have the time I'll try to push a PR with this change myself

items.title: Several launches are created for each process when tests are running in parallel with xdist library
items.body:
Example of test:

```
import logging
from pytest_reportportal import RPLogger, RPLogHandler

logging.setLoggerClass(RPLogger)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
# Create handler for Report Portal.
rp_handler = RPLogHandler()
# Set INFO level for Report Portal handler.
rp_handler.setLevel(logging.INFO)
# Set formatter.
formatter = logging.Formatter('%(asctime)s: - %(levelname)s - %(name)s: %(message)s',
                                        datefmt='%m/%d/%Y %I:%M:%S %p')
rp_handler.setFormatter(formatter)
# Add handler to the logger.
logger.addHandler(rp_handler)


def test_RP():
    assert True == True

def test_RP2():
    assert True == False

```
